page.title: 13CASTLE EDEN DENE:PAGE 1.
page.content: "DENE" IS A NORTH-EASTERN WORD MEANING A STEEP,WOODED GORGE OR VALLEY.CASTLE EDEN DENE DERIVES ITS NAME FROM THE MANY YEW TREES ROUND ABOUT.OUR DENE IS ABOUT 22O HECTARES LONG AND UNTIL THE 1ST OF JULY IT WAS OWNED BY THE PETERLEE DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION AS A LOCAL NATURE RESERVE.IT BECOMES A NATIONAL NATURE RESERVE ON THE ABOVE DATE OWNED BY THE NATIONAL CONSERVANCY COUNCIL. ABOUT 2,5OO DIFFERENT SORTS OF ANIMAL LIFE LIVE IN THE DENE,THE MOST FAMOUS OF WHICH IS THE EDEN ARGUS BUTTERFLY.IT IS NOT FOUND ANY WHERE ELSE.IN 1983 THERE WERE ABOUT 5,5OO OF THESE RARE CREATURES.SOME PLACES IN THE DENE HAVE NAMES LIKE GUNNER'S POOL AND THE BANANA CAVES.JACOB'S LADDER IS A VERY DANGEROUS CLIFF AND SHOULD NOT BE USED FOR PLAYING ON.A BOY WAS KILLED THERE RECENTLY.THE NAMES HAVE BORN OF LOCAL LEGENDS.
